talents.name: Commune with Divinity
effect: Maintain your Composure at Challenge 3 to align yourself with the divine. Gain Hits in Concordance.
Your Concordance measures how closely you are aligned with your Divine Doctrine.
You may use this Ability without using an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint.  If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 8 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Divine Doctrine
effect:
You follow set of principles in your belief system or religious practice, referred to as your Divine Doctrine. Each Divine Doctrine consists of Virtues, Taboos, and Domains.
When you act against your Virtues or engage in a Taboo, reduce your Concordance by 1.

Select two items from the list below to be your Virtues and two items to be your Taboos:
Temperance, Indulgence, Avarice, Charity, Humility, Compassion, Wrath, Courage, Deceipt, Justice, Loyalty, Honesty . . .

Select 2 Effect Skills from the list below to be your Domain:
Bellor, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Ordi, Rime, Tempest, Vivus

Commitment to your Divine Doctrine lets you access Rites. If one your Rite's result set contains a 1, reduce your Concordance by 1.
If you attempt to use a Rite when you Concordance is below 0, add 1 Hazard die to the roll for each point your Concordance is below 0.

talents.name: Seek Mysteries

Intuit, Research, or use your Insight to unravel these mysteries further, gaining Hits in Arcana Ranks to invest in your Arcana.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 4 Actions.

talents.name: Strain Susceptibility
effect: Your pursuit of Arcana expose you to Strain.
When you roll one of your Affinity to invoke and Arcana, you gain Strain according to the result as soon as the Arcana effects resolve.
Strain accumulates over the course of your adventures, only reducing by 1d6 at the conclusion of a Waypoint.

You suffer the effects of Strain according to the Straing Effects Table table below. Strain Effects are cumulative:
StrainEffect
0-4No effect
5-9Fatigued 1
10-14Confused
15-19Fatigued 2
20-24Vulnerable 3
25-29Stunned 4
30+Dead

effect: Use a Shift to Wait For It with the condition that an ally scores 1+ Hits against your target in melee combat.  When the the condition is met, Shoot your target dealing Hits directly to their Grit.

talents.name: Pinning Shot
effect: Shoot your target, reducing Hits in the result set by -2 but giving your target Restrained 2.

talents.name: Piercing Shots
effect: You know how punch through your targets' defenses, scoring +1 Bonus Hits to their Grit when you score 1+ Hits with Shoot.

talents.name: Reflex Shot
effect: When you are the target on Ambush, you immediately dela +1d4 Bonus Hits to one target.

talents.name: Suppressing Fire
effect: Use your Tactics to fire a ranged weapon in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, protecting your allies by forcing your enemies to seek cover.
Allies can ignore a number of Hazards in the targetted Zone equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Crippling Shot
effect: Shoot your target, redicing Hits in the result set by -2 but giving your target Fatigued 1 and Wounded 1.

talents.name: Two Birds, One Shot
effect: Shoot two targets in your Current or an Adjacent Zon, dividing Hits between the two.

talents.name: Ready
effect: You can use the Use Your Equipment Shift to reload, draw, or restring / unjam a ranged weapon once per turn without using your Shift.

talents.name: Shoot (2)
effect: Increase your Shoot Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Shoot (2)
effect: Increase your Shoot Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Double Tap
effect: Shoot your target at Hazard 1.  Add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Shoot (3)
effect: Increase your Shoot Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Shooter
effect: When you Shoot your target but earn 0 Hits, add +2 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Controlled Pair
effect: When you Shoot a target with no 1s in the result set, you may immediately make a second Shoot attempt.

talents.name: Float like a butterfly. . .
effect: Until the beginning of your next turn, use Reflexes +1d4 as as your Primary Defense.

talents.name: Back Stance
effect: Defensive Stance
You assume a Defensive Stance.  You may maintain this stance until you use a different Shift as long as your Reflexes are above 0.
While you maintain this Stance, reduce all Hits from using your Martial Arts by -1.

talents.name: Front Stance
effect: Aggressive Stance
You assume an Aggressive Stance, You may maintain this Stance until you use a different Shift and as long as your Reflexes are above 0.
While you maintain this Stance, add +1 Bonus Hits when using your Martial Arts.

talents.name: Martial Arts (2)
effect: Increase your Martial Arts Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Martial Arts (3)
effect: Increase your Martial Arts Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Knee Strike
effect: When you are in an Aggressive Stance and score 4+ Hits in melee combat, your target gains Fatigued 2.

talents.name: Ridge Hand Strike
effect: When you are in an Aggressive Stance and score 4+ Hits in melee combat, your taget gains Dazed 1.

talents.name: High Block
effect: When you are in a Defensive Stance and take 4+ Hits in melee combat from an attacker you can see, reduce the total hits by -1.

talents.name: Parry
effect: When you are in a Defensive Stance and take Hits in melee combat from an attacker you can see, reduce your Reflexes by 1 and reduce the Hits by 3.

talents.name: Dual Strike
effect: You can split Hits scored by your Martial Arts between 2 melee targets in your Current Zone.

talents.name: Living Weapon
effect: When you use your Martial Arts against your target but earn 0 Hits, add +2 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Sweep the Leg
effect: Use your Martial Arts against your target and reduce the Hits by -2.  If 1+ Hits remain, your target becomes Prone.

talents.name: Counterstrike
effect: When you Parry a melee attack, immediately use your Martial Arts against the attacker at scoring Hits -2.

talents.name: First Aid
effect: Score 2+ Hits with your Medicine to have one target in your Current Zone regain +X Grit, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Medicine (2)
effect: Increase your Medicine Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Stop Whining!
effect: Use your Medicine to reduce the Wounded rating of one target in your Current Zone by X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Smelling Salts
effect: Use your Medicine to reduce the Unconscious rating of one target in your Current Zone by X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Snap Out of It!
effect: Use your Medicine to reduce the Dazed or Stunned rating of one target in your Current Zone by X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: I'll Patch You Up
effect: Use your Medicine to have one target in your Current Zone recover X to their Primary Defense, where X is euqal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Stem the Bleeding
effect: Use your Medicine to reduce the Dying Rating of one target in your current zone by X, where X is equal to Hits -1 in the result set.

talents.name: Medicine (3)
effect: Increase your Medicine Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Medicine (4)
effect: Increase your Medicine Rank to 4 (d12).

talents.name: Emergency Medicine
effect: You can use Abilities that use Medicine as Shifts instead of an Actions.

talents.name: Avowed Quest
effect: Your are on a Quest of great importance. Write a new Target with the Quest keyword to represent this undertaking. Work with the BAMF to structure this Target. You may only have one Quest of this type active at a time.
Your Quest grants you Conviction, allowing you to access powers to be used in pursuit of your Quest.  When you gain this Talent, your Conviction equals 5.

As you set out on a Quest, select one Effect Skill from the list below to be your Boon, and gain +1 Skill Rank in the chosen Skill:
Bellor, Destroy, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Ordi, Vivus
Each time you gain 1+ Milestones from a part of your Quest, your Conviction increases by +5.
If you fail to complete your Quest, lose 1 Renown and increase the Entropy by +5.
If you have no Quest, your Conviction is 0.  You may write a new Target with the Quest keyword at the beginning of the each Waypoint.

talents.name: Strike with Conviction
effect: Spend 2 Conviction.  The next time you Strike, Shoot, or use Martial Arts against a target this turn, automatically us one Effect Trigger from you Boon.

talents.name: Strike (2)
effect: Increase your Strike Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Boon (2)
effect: Increase your Boon Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Relentless Conviction
effect: Increase the Entropy by +2 to regain +3 Conviction

talents.name: Wrathful Conviction
effect: Spend 2 Conviction, then use your Boon to harm your foe scoring Hits against one target in your Current Zone.

talents.name: Eternal Conviction
effect: When you are Dying, you may spend 2 Conviction and increase the Entropy by +4.  You recover from the Dying status, regain 3 Grit, and Recover without using an Action.

talents.name: Strike (3)
effect: Increase your Strike Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Boon (3)
effect: Increase your Boon Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: I Am Inevitable.
effect:
If you succesfully complete every part of a Quest, you may immediately spend 5 Momentum to roll 1d20:
  • If you roll 12+, increase the Momentum by +3. You and all allies gain +1 Milestone, and you gain +2 Renown.
  • If you roll 11 or less, increase the Entropy by +5 and gain +2 Enemies.

talents.name: Double or Nothing
effect: When you take an Action that contains no 1s in the result set without any re-rolls, reduce your Nerve by Hits and roll 1d20.

talents.name: Blooded
effect: You are Resistant to posion damage.

talents.name: Strong Arm
effect: You can Throw weapons into Adjacent Zones.

talents.name: Swift Offense
effect: When you attack a target that has not yet acted in this encounter, add +1d4 Bonus hits to the result set.

talents.name: Smooth Talker
effect: You can spend Momentum to add Hits to the results set of any Action taken to Deceive or Persuade.

talents.name: Shift Forms
effect: Use Forma to transform yourself and gain Form Aura X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set + your Forma Rank.  While this Aura persists, you may use Talents with the Altered Form keyword.

If you use a Talent with the Altered Form keyword that specifies a Skill, use your Form Aura as the Skill Rank to determine the type of dice you roll.  If your form Aura is equal to or greater than 4, you roll a d12.
When your Form Aura equals 0, you gain Fatigued 2.

talents.name: Savage Form
effect: Altered Form
Use Strike or Intimidate against one target in your Current Zone, or use Exert.
On 2+ Hits, you may create one (1) Advantage in your Current Zone and have all targets in your Current Zone become Provoked.

talents.name: Nimble Form
effect: Altered Form
Use Stealth, Legerdemain, or Tumble.
You may use an additional Shift this turn.

talents.name: Stalwart Form
effect: Altered Form
Use Grapple or Insight against one target in your Current Zone; or use Investigate, Perceive, or Survival.
You may immediately use the Recover action.

talents.name: Clever Form
effect: Altered Form
Use Analyze, Deceive, Implements, Navigate, or Streetwise.
On 4+ Hits, you may immediately take another Action.

talents.name: Swift Form
effect: Altered Form
Shift to Move, ignoring Hazards.  You may immediately use another Shift.

talents.name: Vicious Form
effect: Altered Form
Strike one target in your Current Zone, adding +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.  The target gains Vulnerable 1 and all other targets in your Current Zone gain Afraid 1.
On 5+ Hits, you may immediately take another Action.

talents.name: Ruinous Form
talents.requires: Forma 4, Four other Altered Form Talents.
effect: Altered Form

Spend 2 Form Aura to Strike all targets in your Current Zone and they become Prone, then Create X Hazards in your Current Zone, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  Increase the Entropy by +3.
On 4+ Hits, all targets in all Adjacent Zone suffer X-3 Hits and become Prone, then create X-3 Haxards in all Adjacent Zones.  Increase the Entropy by +1.

talents.name: Aegis Form
effect: Altered Form
Endure to gain X Armor Defense and regain +X Grit, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  All targets in your Current and Adjacent Zone become Provoked.
On 4+ Hits, you may reduce one Status by -2.

talents.name: Embrace the Forms
effect: Spend 1 Form Aura to add +1d4 Bonus Hits to your next Action's result set.

talents.name: This Isn't Even My Final Form
effect: Spend 1 Momentum and 4 Grit to immideately use Forma and increase your Form Aura by +X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  Increase the Entropy by +1.

talents.name: Feed the Forms
effect: When you use an Action with the Altered Form keyword and score 4+ Hits, increase your Form Aura by +1.

talents.name: Altered Form
effect: When you use Forma to gain a Form Aura, choose one (1) of the following keywords:
Nightsight, Flying, Aquatic
While your Form Aura persists, you gain the chosen keyword.

talents.name: Elusive Form
effect: Altered Form
When you Defy Danger using Stealth or Tumble, add +X Bonus Hits to the result set, where X is equal to you Form Aura.

talents.name: Forma (1)
effect: Increase your Forma Rank to 1 (d6).

talents.name: Forma (2)
effect: Increase your Forma Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Forma (3)
effect: Increase your Forma Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Forma (4)
effect: Increase your Forma Rank to 4 (d12).

talents.name: Recruit Henchmen
effect: Persuade to gain Hits + Savvy Henchmen Ranks to recruit Minions with the Henchmen keyword from the Minions table.
Henchmen are a type of Minion you can command to do your bidding.
Each type of Henchman has it own Rating which specifies the number of Henchmen Ranks you mus invest to recruit them.
The different Henchmen have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Melee and Ranged ratings, and any Triggers they have.
If one of your Henchman's Grit reaches 0, they die.  You may compose a letter of condolences to their next of kin if you see fit to stoop.
Your Henchmen wait for your instruction.  On each of your turns, your Henchmen may only use a Shift to Move or Defy Danger unless you use a Talent to lead them.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are in a city.  If you use it during a Waypoint while you are in a city, it requires 7 + Savvy Actions (minimum 1 Action).

Advanced Henchmen: Each Henchman also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Henchmen have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Henchman's rating by using the Promote Henchman talent.

talents.name: Promote Henchmen
effect: When you Persuade to Recruit Henchmen, you may spend Henchmen Ranks to increase your current Henchmen's Minion ratings.
Each Henchmen rating costs a number of Henchmen Ranks equal to the rating value (i.e., rating 2 = 2 Henchmen Ranks, rating 3 = 3 Henchmen Ranks).

talents.name: Skilled Recruiter
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: When you recruit Minions, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Coordinated Strike
effect: Lead your Minions to launch a coordinated melee against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits to the target, where X is the sum of your Minions' Melee stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: Weapons Free!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Use a Shift to Lead X Minions to score Hits equal to their Ranged Stat to any number of targets in their Current or an Adjacent Zone, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.

talents.name: Don't Just Stand There!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Use a Shift to Lead X Minions to score Hits equal to their Melee Stat to any number of targets in their Current Zone, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.

talents.name: Coordinated Volley
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead your Minions to launch a coordinated ranged attack against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits to the target, where X is the sum of your Minons' Ranged stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: At Ease, Soldiers!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead X Minions in your Current Zone to regain 2 Grit, where X is equal to Hits in the result set. These Minions cannot Shift or take an Action this turn.

talents.name: Rally the Troops
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Spend 4 Momentum to allow all Minions in your Current Zone to regain up to 2 Grit.

talents.name: Lead (2)
effect: Increase your Lead Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Persuade (2)
effect: Increase your Persuade Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Lead (3)
effect: Increase your Lead Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Stir the Dead
effect: Use Mori to gain Hits + Mori Haunt Ranks to recruit Haunts from the Haunt Minions table.
Haunts are a type of undead Minion you can command to do you bidding.
Each type of Haunt has it own Rating which specifies the number of Haunts Ranks you mus invest to recruit them.
The different Haunts have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Melee and Ranged ratings, and any Triggers they have.
If one of your Haunt's Grit reaches 0, they are released from your service and rejoin the souls you've yet to disturb.
Your Haunts wait for your instruction.  On each of your turns, your Haunts may only use a Shift to Move unless you use a Talent to lead them.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are near the spirits or remain of the dead.  If you use it during a Waypoint while you are near the spirits or remain of the dead, it requires 6 - Mori Rank Actions (minimum 1 Action).

Advanced Haunts: Each Haunt also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Haunt have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Haunts's rating by using the Empower Haunts talent.

talents.name: Empower Haunts
effect: When you use Mori to Stir the Dead, you may spend Haunt Ranks to increase your current Haunts' Minion ratings.
Each Haunt rating costs a number of Haunt Ranks equal to the rating value (i.e., rating 2 = 2 Haunt Ranks, rating 3 = 3 Haunt Ranks).

talents.name: Danse Macabre
effect: When you use Mori to Stir the Dead, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Rip and Tear!
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead your Minions to launch a coordinated melee against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits to the target, where X is the + sum of your Minions' Melee stat in the target's Current Zone.
If the target dies, one other target in the same Zone becomes Afraid of your Minions.

talents.name: Feast On Their Flesh!
effect: Lead X Haunts to score 1 Hit against any number of targets in their Current Zones and regain 1 Grit, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.

talents.name: Dread Siphon
effect: Use Mori to score X Hits against one target in your Current Zone, where X is the number of Hits in your result set.
If X is +3+, up to X allies and/or Minions to regain up to 2 Grit.

talents.name: Dread Presence
effect: Intimidate targets in your Current Zone, forcing Hits + your Mori Rank targets to become Afraid of you.

talents.name: Swarm the Enemy
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Use a Shift to Lead X Minions to immediately Shift to Move into one target's Current Zone.  Minions must be in a Zone Adjacent to the target Zone.
Once in position, the target suffers X + the sum of your Minions' Melee stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: Death's Reach
effect: Lead your Haunts to launch a coordinated ranged attack against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits the the target, where X is the Hits in the result set + sum of your Haunts Ranged stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: Bone Splinters
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: When a Minion dies in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, use Mori.  On 2+ Hits, up to 2 targets in the dead target's Zone take 2 Hits.

talents.name: Lead (2)
effect: Increase your Lead Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Intimidate (2)
effect: Increase your Intimidate Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Mori (1)
effect: Increase your Mori Rank to 1 (d6).

talents.name: Mori (2)
effect: Increase your Mori Rank to 2 (d6).

talents.name: Mori (3)
effect: Increase your Mori Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Mori (4)
effect: Increase your Mori Rank to 4 (d12).

talents.name: Corpse Explosion
effect: When a target you can see that has a corporeal form dies in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, use Mori.  On 3+ Hits, all other targets in the dead target's Zone take 2 Hits.

talents.name: Tame Beasts
effect: Maintain your Composure at to gain Hits + Steady Beast Ranks to recruit Beasts from the Beast Minions table.
Beasts are a type of Minion you train to follow your commands.
Each type of Beast has it own Rating which specifies the number of Beast Ranks you must invest to recruit them.
The different Beasts have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Actions, and any Talents they have.
If one of your Beasts' Grit reaches 0, they die.  You're a terrible person if you let your pets die.
Your Beasts wait for your instruction.  On each of your turns, your Beasts may only use a Shift to Move unless you use a Talent to lead them.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are near a fertile wilderness region.  If you use it during a Waypoint while you are near a fertile wilderness region, it requires 7 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

Advanced Beasts: Each Beast also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Beasts have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Beasts' rating by using the Train Beasts talent.

talents.name: Train Beast
effect: When you maintain your Composure to Tame Beasts, you may spend Beast Ranks to increase your current Beasts' Minion ratings.
Each Beast rating costs a number of Beast Ranks equal to the rating value (i.e., rating 2 = 2 Beast Ranks, rating 3 = 3 Beast Ranks).

talents.name: Friend of the Wilds
effect: When you maintain your Composure to Tame Beasts, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the reuslt set.

talents.name: Pack Tactics
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead your Minions to launch a coordinated melee against a single target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, dealing X Hits to the target, where X is the sum of your Minions' Melee stat in the target's Current Zone.

talents.name: Protect the Alpha
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Lead X Minions to Shift one Zone closer to your Current Zone, where X is the number of Hits in the resul set.  Until your next turn, any Hits you suffer are redirected to Minions in yoru Current Zone.

talents.name: One of the Pack
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Use a Shift to Strike, Shoot, or use your Martial Arts against a target you can see in your Current Zone.  On 3+ Hits, all Minions under your command may score Hits equal to their Melee Stat against any target in their Current Zones.

talents.name: Feed the Pack
effect: Lead X Beasts in your Current Zone to regain 2 Grit, where X is equal to Hits in the result set. These Beasts cannot Shift or take an Action this turn.

talents.name: Gather the Pack
talents.requires: Recruit Henchmen, Stir the Dead, or Tame Beasts
effect: Spend 3 Momentum to allow all Minions under your command to move up to 1 Zone closer to you and regain 1 Grit.

talents.name: Lead (3)
effect: Increase your Lead Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Composure (3)
effect: Increase your Composure Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Commune with Divinity
effect:
Maintain your Composure at Challenge 3 to align yourself with the divine. Gain Hits in Concordance.
Your Concordance measures how closely you are aligned with your Divine Doctrine.

If the result set of one of your Rites contains a 1, reduce your Concordance by 1.
If you attempt to use a Rite when you Concordance is below 0, add 1 Hazard die to the roll for each point your Concordance is below 0.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint.  If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 8 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Domain (2)
effect: Increase one of your Domain Ranks to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Divine Doctrine
effect:
You follow set of principles in your belief system or religious practice, referred to as your Divine Doctrine. Each Divine Doctrine consists of Virtues, Taboos, and Domains.
When you act against your Virtues or engage in a Taboo, reduce your Concordance by 1.

Select two items from the list below to be your Virtues and two items to be your Taboos:
Temperance, Indulgence, Avarice, Charity, Humility, Compassion, Wrath, Courage, Deceipt, Justice, Loyalty, Honesty . . .

Select 2 Effect Skills from the list below to be your Domain:
Bellor, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Ordi, Rime, Tempest, Vivus
Commitment to your Divine Doctrine lets you access Rites.

talents.name: Invoke the Divine
effect: When you Commune with Divinity to gain Concordance, add +1d4 Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Extended Domain
effect:
Select 1 additional Effect Skills from the list below to add to your Domain:
Bellor, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Ordi, Rime, Tempest, Vivus

talents.name: Domain (2)
effect: Increase one of your Domain Ranks to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Domain (3)
effect: Increase one of your Domain Ranks to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Derive Axioms
effect: Analyze at Challenge 5 to gain X Axioms, where X is equal to Hits in the result set + your Rank in Arithm.

talents.name: Measurement Error
effect: When an ally in your Current Zone rolls a 1 in the result set of an Action, you may spend 1 Axiom to allow them to reroll the 1 without spending a Trait point.

talents.name: Lambda
effect:
Spend 2 Axioms and Analyze to gain Aura X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set. Choose one (1):
  • Hits are scored on rolls of 3 or greater.
  • Hits are scored on rolls of 5 or greater.
While the Aura persists, the chosen effect remains true.

talents.name: Proficiency Decay
effect: Spend 3 Axioms and Analyze to have X target allies in your Current or an Adjacent Zone gain Aura 1, where X is equal to Hits in the results set.  While this Aura persists, target allies may ignore 1s in their result sets and each Action target allies take increases the Momentum by the number of Hits in the Action's result set.

talents.name: Inverse Cumulative Distribution
effect: When your team loses the Initiative, you may spend Momentum and/or Axioms, then roll 1d20+X, where X is the total Momentum and Axioms spent (X cannot be 0).  If the result of the d20 is greater than 14, your team maintains the Initiative.

talents.name: Differentiation Ray
effect: Spend 3 Axioms and Analyze to have one target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone takes X + 2 Hits to their Grit, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  If the target's Grit is reduced to 0 by this effect, they disintegrate.

talents.name: Central Limit Theorem
effect: Analyze your current situation.  On 3+ Hits, The Timer becomes 3.  Until the Timer expires, all Shifts and Actions score 3 Hits.  Every 4th roll, the Initiative shifts to the opposing team.

talents.name: Random Walk
effect: Analyze or use Arithm to gain Armor Defense X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  When you use your Armor Defense to absorb Hits scored against you, you may immediately Shift to Move to an Adjacent Zone ignoring Hazards.

talents.name: Uncertainty Field
effect: When a target that can see you score hits against you, you may spend 1 Axiom to force the target to reroll the entire result set, keeping the second result.  If the new result set does not score hits against you, you may gain Hidden X, where X is equal to hits in the target's new result set.

talents.name: Real Analysis
effect: Your use of the Analyze skill gain the Arithm keyword.

talents.name: Analyze (2)
effect: Increase your Analyze Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Analyze (3)
effect: Increase your Analyze Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Analyze (4)
effect: Increase your Analyze Rank to 4 (d12).

talents.name: Arithm (1)
effect: Increase your Arithm Rank to 1 (d6).

talents.name: Arithm (2)
effect: Increase your Arithm Rank to 2 (d8).

talents.name: Arithm (3)
effect: Increase your Arithm Rank to 3 (d10).

talents.name: Arithm (4)
effect: Increase your Arithm Rank to 4 (d12).

talents.name: Hone the mind
effect: Focus

talents.name: Attune with Essence
effect: Focus or use your Insight to connect with your power, gaining Hits in Attunement.
Attunment measures the strength of connection to your power, which determines the strength of the Marvels you can manifest.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 8 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).

talents.name: Bonded Essence
effect:
When you gain this Talent, select 1 Effect Skill from the list below to be an Affinity allowing you to further empower your Spells with Skill Talents:
Aether, Bellor, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nihil, Nox, Ordi, Rime, Squall, Tempest, Torrent, Vivus
Your Essence is innately bound to this Affinity, allowing you to manifest its effects into reality by using Marvels.
If the result set of one of your Marvels contains a 1, reduce your Atttunement by X, where X is equal to Hits in the same result set.

talents.name: Temporal Deceleration
effect: Use Tempor and choose one target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone.  On 2+ Hits, the target gains Slowed 3.

talents.name: Temporal Exclusion
effect: Use Tempor and target your Current or an Adjacent Zone to gain Aura X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  While this Aura persists, the targeted Zone is frozen in time.  All targets within the targeted Zone gain Silenced X, Restrained X, and can take no Actions.
Any targets that Shift to Move into and any items or effects that enter the Zone immediately suffer these effects.
When this Aura ends, your gain Slowed 2 and Fatigued 1.

talents.name: Temporal Acceleration
effect:
Use Tempor to have one target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone gain Aura X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set. While this Aura persists, the target gains the following effects:
  • Your Primary Defense is Reflexes. You gain +10 to your Rexlexes Defense.
  • You gain 1 additional Shift on each of your turns.
  • You gain 1 additional Action on each of your turns.
  • When this Aura ends, you gain Slowed 2 and Fatigued 3.
When this Aura ends, the current Timer decreases by -2.

talents.name: Timekeeper
effect: Use Tempor to gain Aura X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  While this Aura persists, you gain Fatigued 2, Dazed 1, and your team cannot lose the Initiative.
Use Tempor to create an Auxiliary Timer X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  While the Auxiliary Timer persists, the current Timer stops and only you act on each of the Auxiliary turns.
When the Auxiliary Timer ends, you gain Dazed 1, Fatigued 2, Silenced 2, and Slowed 2.

talents.name: Ex Epilogo ad Prologum
effect: Use Tempor to end the current Waypoint.  On 2+ Hits, the current Waypoint ends.  Any Targets and situations active in the current Waypoint advance accordingly.
The next Waypoint begins immediately.

talents.name: Relive History
effect: Use Tempor to gain Aura X start a new Waypoint, where X is equal to your  Uncanny Trait + Hits in the result set.  The new Waypoint begins at any point in the game fiction's timeline and encompasses X Timers.  When this Aura ends (i.e., the last Timer concludes), you return to this point in the game fiction's timeline, but things may not be as tehy once were. . .

talents.name: Phase Shift
effect: Use Tempor and choose one target in your Current Zone.  On 3+ Hits, the target disappears from the current encounter until the beginning of the next round and you gain Slowed 2.

talents.name: Speedy Recovery
effect: Use Tempor and decrease the current Timer by -1.  All targets in your Current Zone reduce all statuses by X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

talents.name: Make the Time
effect: Use Tempor to gain Stunned X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  Set the current Timer to X.

talents.name: I'm Not Done Yet
effect: When this round ends and the enemy team has the Initiative, you may gain Fatigued 2 and increase the current Timer by +1.

talents.name: Pause the Sands
effect: When the current Timer equals 1, you may use Tempor to gain Aura X.  While this Aura persists, you gain Fatigued 1, Stunned 2, and the current Timer does not decrease.

talents.name: One of Many Outcomes
effect: When you suffer Hits from a target, you may gain gain Dazed 2 and have the target reroll their effect, using the new result set.

talents.name: Market Savvy
effect: Analyze the markets to acquire Gear, gaining Brokerage Aura X, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  While this Aura persists, all Purchase Thresholds for Gear you attempt to acquire are reduce by -1.
You gain +X Wealth at the end of each Waypoint, where X is equal to your current Brokerage Aura.

talents.name: Information Broker
effect: You can contact experts in a given field to find valuable information for you.  Spend 3 Wealth to have the BAMF use Cosmology, Current Events, History, Linguistucs, Nature, Research, Navigate, Skrimisiology, Streetwise, or Theology at Rank 4 about a specific situation or target.
On 2+ Hits, you Gain +2 Secrets and reduce your Wealth by the total 1s in the BAMF's result set.  The BAMF will provide your Secrets at a time that makes sense in the game fiction.

On 4+ Hits, you Gain +X Secrets reduce your Wealth by the total 1s in the BAMF's result set, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.  The BAMF will provide your Secrets at a time that makes sense in the game fiction.

talents.name: Liability Broker
effect: You are adept at trading Favors with powerful contacts, leveraging their influence to secure valuable alliances and resources.  Persaude a known influential NPC.

On 2+ Hits, you Gain +1 Favor and write a short-term Target in exchange.  The BAMF will give you the details of the Target.  If you do not successfully complete this Target, you gain +2 Enemies, as the NPC seeks repayment.

On 4+ Hits, you Gain +2 Favors and write a short-term Target in exchange. The BAMF will give you the details of the Target.  You may Spend X Wealth to complete the Target, where X is equal to the Target's Reward.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 5 - Savvy Actions (minimum 1 Action) and the Momentum increases by +1.

talents.name: Let's Make a Deal
effect: Persuade or Deceive a target in your Current Zone to negotiate prices, terms, or aggrements, adding +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

talents.name: Insider Trading
effect: Analyze or use Insight to predict a major economic event.  One 2+ Hits, gain +X Wealth, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 5 - Savvy Actions (minimum 1 Action) and the Entropy increases by +1.

talents.name: Never Show Your Cards
effect: When you Initiate a Contest with a target to negotiate, your opponent gains Fatigued 1.

talents.name: Underworld Broker
effect: When you make a Wealth Check to acquire dangerous, rare, or illicit Gear, you may Persaude your market contacts to arrange the Gear to be moved discreetly.  One 2+ Hits, the Gear can be delivered across borders and/or through hostile territory without detection or confiscation.

talents.name: Magnetic Demeanor
effect: When you Persaude or Deceive a target and score 3+ Hits, the target gain Charmed 1.

talents.name: Rapid Acquisitions
effect: Use a Shift to make a Wealth Check to purchase goods.

talents.name: Change Vendors
effect: Spend 1 Brokerage Aura to reroll a Wealth Check.

talents.name: Balanced Portfolio
effect: You maintain a well-rounded investment portfolio across markets.  You gain +2 Wealth at the beginning of each Waypoint.

talents.name: Silent Partner
effect: You are an expoert at conducting financial transactions, brokering deals, or acquiring goods without revealing your identity.  Targets who attempt to trace your business trasactions back to you gain Fatigued 2.
